intro: Euryandra scandens, commonly known as the climbing euryandra, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and slender, woody stems. The plant produces small, fragrant white or pink flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and covered in a fine, whitish pubescence. Euryandra scandens is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy or well-drained soils.
